str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Middle - Genitive Neuter Singular
str2: To pass (of time); I continue through, intervene. From dia and ginomai; to elapse meanwhile.
Or Mariam of Hebrew origin; Maria or Mariam, the name of six Christian females.
Magdalene, a woman of Magdala. Feminine of a derivative of Magdala; a female Magdalene, i.e. Inhabitant of Magdala.
Or Mariam of Hebrew origin; Maria or Mariam, the name of six Christian females.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
The same as Iakob Graecized; Jacobus, the name of three Israelites.
Salome, wife of Zebedee and mother of James and John, the apostles. Probably of Hebrew origin; Salome, an Israelitess.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To buy. From agora; properly, to go to market, i.e. to purchase; specially, to redeem.
Spice, perfume. From airo; an aromatic.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Feminine Plural
Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To anoint: festivally, in homage, medicinally, or in anointing the dead. To oil.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
